intro: Ricinella, commonly known as the ice plant or sea fig, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its succulent leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that often have five petals. The plant is native to coastal areas of Africa, South America, and Australia, where it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. Ricinella species are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Some species are also cultivated as ornamental plants due to their drought tolerance and unique appearance.
